unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Finding the Total Mean: Freddie Just Cannot Get to School on Time
question_text: Freddie has a problem of  showing up to school on time.  Freddie has broken down how his time (in minutes) is spent before school  into four parts. The four parts consists of  getting out of bed (Freddie likes to hit that snooze button), getting ready for school, driving to school, and walking to class (Freddie is a bit of a social butterfly). The chart below shows the mean and standard deviation of the number of minutes it takes Freddie to complete each one of these tasks. Mean Standard Deviation Getting out of bed 20.13 6.23 Getting ready 12.85 4.14 Driving to school 8.26 2.34 Walking to class 7.34 1.79 What is the total mean time of Freddie's four part morning schedule?
